relationships.description: North and northeast winds during winter transport air pollutants from industrialized areas and fire regions in southern China and Southeast Asia to Hanoi
relationships.mechanism: Long-range transport of air pollutants emitted from highly industrialized areas (Pearl River Delta) and intensive fire regions in southern China and Southeast Asia via prevailing north and northeast winds during winter monsoon
relationships.source_title: Seasonal Characteristics of Atmospheric PM2.5 in an Urban Area of Vietnam and the Influence of Regional Fire Activities
relationships.source_quote: With the predominance of north and northeast winds during the winter period, the long-range transport of air pollutants which emitted from the highly industrialized areas and the intensive fire regions in the southern part of China and Southeast Asia region were likely other important sources for the highly elevated concentrations of PM2.5 and its chemical species in the study area.
relationships.notes: Source regions include Pearl River Delta, Southern China, and Southeast Asia

relationships.description: Northeast monsoon carries industrial and urban pollutants from South China megacities to Hanoi during October-March
relationships.mechanism: Northerly winds from northeast monsoon transport pollutants from mega-urban areas (Chengdu, Chongqing) and industrial sources in southern China to Northern Vietnam
relationships.source_title: Analysis of air pollution over Hanoi, Vietnam using multi-satellite and MERRA reanalysis datasets
relationships.source_quote: General synoptic meteorology patterns indicate northerly winds flowing from South China into Northern Vietnam and Hanoi during October–March... During the peak BC months of December and January, wind patterns indicated pollutant transport from southern China megacity areas.
relationships.notes: Peak transport during December-January; source regions include Chengdu, Chongqing, Southern China megacities

relationships.description: South and southeasterly winds transport biomass burning aerosols from Laos and Southern Vietnam to Hanoi during April-August
relationships.mechanism: Southeast monsoon carries pollutants from forest fires and slash-and-burn agriculture in Laos and Northwest Vietnam to Hanoi
relationships.source_title: Analysis of air pollution over Hanoi, Vietnam using multi-satellite and MERRA reanalysis datasets
relationships.source_quote: whereas during Apr-Aug more south or southeasterly winds from Laos, Southern Vietnam, and the South China Sea. During March and April, high BC values over Laos and Northwest province of Vietnam are attributed especially to forest fires and slash and burn agriculture.
relationships.notes: Peak biomass burning transport during March-April; source regions include Laos, Southern Vietnam, South China Sea

relationships.source_title: Seasonal Characteristics of Atmospheric PM2.5 in an Urban Area of Vietnam and the Influence of Regional Fire Activities
relationships.source_quote: The MODIS fire maps showed that fire sources occurring in the southern part of China and the Southeast Asia region (Vietnam, Laos, Thailand, and Myanmar) during the winter period were much more intensive than those during the summer period. As air masses traveled across the highly industrialized and intensive fire regions during the winter period, they might have carried a large amount of air pollutants.
relationships.notes: MODIS fire radiative power data confirms higher fire intensity in winter; chemical species signature includes SO42−, NH4+, K+, OC, EC

summary.main_finding: Wind direction and upwind exposure are critical factors influencing PM2.5 concentrations in Hanoi, with distinct seasonal patterns. During winter (October-March), north and northeast winds transport pollutants from southern China's industrialized regions and regional biomass burning areas. During summer (April-August), south and southeast winds bring pollutants from Laos, southern Vietnam, and maritime sources.
key_mechanisms: Long-range transport via northeast monsoon from southern China megacities
Biomass burning transport from Laos and Northwest Vietnam
Cold surge events enhancing pollutant transport
Low wind speed and stagnating ridge conditions reducing dispersion
Seasonal wind direction changes affecting source regions
